remarks: Lemma for ~ lspprat .  In the second case of ~ lsppratlem1 , ` y e. ( N `` { X , Y } ) C_ ( N `` { x , Y } ) ` and ` y e/ ( N `` { x } ) ` implies ` Y e. ( N `` { x , y } ) ` and thus ` X e. ( N `` { x , Y } ) C_ ( N `` { x , y } ) ` as well. (Contributed by NM, 29-Aug-2014.)
statement:
lspprat.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lspprat.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` W ) $.
lspprat.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` W ) $.
lspprat.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
lspprat.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. S ) $.
lspprat.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
lspprat.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. V ) $.
lspprat.p $e |- ( ph -> U C. ( N ` { X , Y } ) ) $.
lsppratlem1.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` W ) $.
lsppratlem1.x2 $e |- ( ph -> x e. ( U \ { .0. } ) ) $.
lsppratlem1.y2 $e |- ( ph -> y e. ( U \ ( N ` { x } ) ) ) $.
lsppratlem4.x3 $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( N ` { x , Y } ) ) $.
lsppratlem4 $p |- ( ph -> ( X e. ( N ` { x , y } ) /\ Y e. ( N ` { x , y } ) ) ) $.
